39485201.review:
IL-2 F**kwolf... no? It's Sturmovik? Well, F**kwolf would've been a much better name for a plane, anyway.

Let's just say it hasn't aged well. The planes and custom missions and stuff are great. Planes even look good from the inside. The game is a... semi-sim? No idea. It feels somewhat realistic (not a pilot here!) and yet the physics are silly enough that you can't imagine real planes handling like that (you can turn the plane upside down on the runway without a lot of speed, effort or damage to the plane :D )

I'd say the game excels in how much it wants you not to play it! Tutorials are excruciatingly boring and non-interactive with MS Paint text written over in red font. Not in comic-sans, sadly. The interface is terrible. It's both badly designed and bad looking. I had some pains getting it to run on Win 10 64-bit and now that it runs it's not as smooth as one would expect. The terrain looks like crap, so much disappoint. Graphics partially look like they were bad even when the game was new. The loading times are annoying, and omg how long did those last back in the day?! How is this being sold for 10 euro? There's abandonware out there that's worth more than this.

TL;DR
A confusing sim-y game that demands a joystick, a crapload of patience and a time machine to transport yourself back to when this was worth playing.

[h1]4/10[/h1]

38460637.review:
[h1] 종이비행기 시뮬레이터	[/h1]


준비물: 가위, 풀 그리고 조이스틱.

종이비행기를 띄우는 법:

1.엔진을 킨다.
2.플랩을 이륙상태로 조정한다.
3.출력을 천천히 높이며, 러더를 밟으며 항공기 이동 경로를 직선으로 유지한다.
4.난다고래.

이 게임은 워썬더 아케이드 돌린 유저들이 ㅈ도 모르고 돌리다간, 땅에서 뜨지도 못하고 작살나는 광경을 볼 수 있습니다.
위에 설명에 이륙 방법이 대충 그렇듯 이건 하드한 시뮬레이션 게임입니다. 특히 섬세하게 조종할 것들이 많습니다.(폭격조준기 조절 등)
또한 워썬더 시뮬레이션 모드를 해본 유저들은 마우스로 해봤다고 해서 이 게임 역시 마우스로 조종 가능 할 거란 생각은 버리세요.


장점: 다양한 항공기와 높은 자유도.

게임 이름이 1946인데는 이유가 있습니다. 바로 페이퍼플랜에서만 존재하던 항공기까지 구현해낸 겁니다.
VTOL기를 프롭기 가득한 시대에서 굴리거나, 그 외에도 초기형 제트기등을 탑승할 수 있습니다.
또한 대표 참전국들의 항공기들을 대부분 구현하여 탈 것도 굉장히 많습니다.

또한 맵 에디터를 이용하여 샌드박스 게임처럼 여러 오브젝트(전차, 함선 등)을 배치하여 자유롭게 비행하실 수 있습니다.
물론 AI가 좀 멍청한지라, 이동경로가 겹칠 시 서로 회피하지 않고 박치기 하는 경우가 있습니다.

모드 역시 존재합니다. 핵폭탄 모드를 설치하여 B-29에 키 큰 쇼넨과 돼지새끼를 탑재하여 도쿄핫을 재현할 수 있습니다. 필수적인 모드는 HSFX 모드 입니다.


단점: 구닥다리 게임의 고질적인 문제

옛날 게임의 단점은 무언가를 수동으로 업데이트 해줘야 하는 단점이 있습니다. 예를 들어 Dangerous waters라는 게임은 윈10에서 돌아가지 않아 따로 패치를 해줘야 하는 단점이 있습니다.

이 게임은 윈10에서 구동되지 않는 단점은 없지만 업데이트를 수동으로 해주셔야 합니다. 또한 모드를 설치하려면 포럼에서 직접 들어가셔서 압축풀고 폴더에 쑤셔 넣어야하는 번거로움이 있습니다.


[u] 워썬더하다가 이걸하면 워썬더는 좆병신겜이라는걸 아실 수 있습니다. 류세이도 공식적으로 넣어주지... [/u]

36073818.review:
I've been playing this game for some years now, beginning with 'Forgotten Battles' and I believe it to still be the finest air combat game there is.  It has been developed continuously and runs very smoothly.  As an example of the level of detail; I read recently that Hawker Typhoons and Tempests had retractable tail wheels.  I launched Sturmovik, took off in a Tempest and found to my amazement that the tail wheel on the game model did indeed retract.  
The ground details are a bit dated now, but are still more than adequate.
If you want to fly a huge range of WWII aircraft on many different fronts in hundreds of situations, then this is the game for you.  I highly recommend it.  Pity there is not a stronger British contingent or a WWI version.

突然想起十多年前骑车在一个二线城市的几个电脑城到处寻找这款游戏的情景，时月就此别过，但那份激动寻觅的心情今天回味都仿佛如昨天重现。记得终于在电脑城买回了第一代
il2，仅有400多Ｍ体积，还附有一本当时少见的说明书，至今还保留着。这是最棒的电风扇模拟游戏，接近现实的气动，丰富的机型，还有在当年很吃电脑配件的设置，看不懂的英文操作，以及数目不小的一批外设投入，使得这款游戏成为一个很硬核的飞行游戏。喜欢的喜欢的要命，不喜欢的绝不涉足。制作组至今还在发布更新包，也注定是因为对il2的热爱和敬意。虽然今天已经有画面更好的bos，但1946是记忆中不容缺失的驿站。有时侯静静的沉浸在里面，去品味和回忆人生之前的涉猎。

Ил-2: Штурмовик, забытая культовая игра, но в своё время (2001 год) в эту игру играло много людей, но потом у ней безнадёжно устарел графон, и разработчики забросили симулятор, последний патч вышел в 2015-ом. Тем не менее, мне игра понравилась, если учесть что разработчики старались разработать реалистичный авиасимулятор, а на графику, положили советский болт.

Итого, моя оценка: 10 бомб ФАБ-100 из 10

+ Сверхреалистичная Лётная Модель
+ Детализированное Управление (Шаг Винта; Высотный Коректор; Яркость Прицела и т.п.)
+ Более 200 самолётов
+ Небедный редактор Миссий, в котором правда трудно разобратся
+ Дофига карт, позволяищих отлетатся на многих Театрах Военных Действий Второй Мировой Войны, от Северной Нормандии, до Тихого Океана
+ Возможность создать свою Схему Окраски из файла Void, также нихилый набор Схем Окраски По умолчанию
- Графика 2001 года
- В детализированном управлении трудно разобратся
- Нужно долго просматривать обучаловки, что-бы понять механику игры
- Примерно 20 самолётов из 200 нелетабельные (можно сделать их стационарными, или посадить за штурвал Бота)

P.S. То чувство когда ты последний человек играющий в Ил-2: Штурмовик)

34840383.review:
This game is an example of when a game holds it's replay value long after the expected life cycle.  If you are into WW2 Flight Sims, or WW2 Combat Air Combat then this game is for you.  Now it is not a "NEW" game, so the graphics are not what we see now (Think 10 Years Ago - Graphics) , but the playability is off the charts.  I do think you will want a flight stick if possible, and you can get by with a standard joystick, but this could be difficult with just a keyboard and mouse system.   

I read a few other reviews, and none seem to talk about something special with this game, it is VERY VERY VERY modable. For Example:  The B.A.T Mod adds 2X the planes and some are the planes that never really got off the drawing board.  Also the mod adds jets, and does try and update the graphics somewhat.   Now with the mod it can change the requirments of your computer to need a more modern computer.   The BAT mod adds about 62 Gig of fixes, add-ons, missions, campaigns, and other good stuff.  (The Mod is not on Steam, you will have to google, find, then download and install it yourself)

This is my GOTO game, it is the game when I am board and just wanting to kill time.  I recommend it 10/10: But remember that it is a Simulation at heart, so don't expect the game to hold your hand as you fly around.  It does have a learning curve, so you have been warned.

34158271.review:
Jeden z najlepszych simów jakie kiedykolwiek stworzono.

Grafika szału nie robi, ale nie odrzuca. Dźwięki przeciętne, ale nie ranią uszu. Gra ma już swoje lata więc są to raczej normalne "problemy". Za to grywalnością bije na głowę wszystko inne. Zarówno grafikę jak i dźwięki da się polepszyć modami.

Już goła gra zapewnia zbawę na co najmniej kilkaset godzin, a z modami takimi jak B.A.T. na kilka tysięcy godzin. W sieci dostępne są setki kampanii i tysiące pojedyńczych misji.

Gra zawiera kilkadziesiąt różnych typów samolotów z lat 1936 - 1946, wyżej wspomniany mod dodaje samoloty od 1906 do czasów współczesnych. Tak więc można polatać zarówno Fokkerem Dr.I jak i F16. Choć oczywiście główną atrakcją są maszyny z czasów ww2.

Dynamiczne kampanie można grać w zasadzie w kółko.

Dostępne są wszystkie strony konfliktu, w tym Finlandia czy Bułgaria, o Włochach, ZSRR, USA, Wlk. Brytanii i Japonii niewspominając. Fińska kampania jest zresztą jedną z ciekawszych.

Pierwszego Il2 kupiłem zaraz po premierze, potem wydanie zbiorcze na płytce, a teraz też i wersję Steam.

Jedyny minus, to konieczność posiadania joysticka i to raczej lepszej jakości, byle jaki nie sprawdzi się. Na myszy/klawiaturze nie polata się. Ale to w końcu sim,  więc też trudno uznać to za faktyczny minus.

Doskonały początek dla początkujących fanów simów. Poziom realizmu i trudności można zmieniać i dostosowywać zarówno do posiadanego sprzętu jak i umiejętności.

Gra chodzi na win7 i win10 bez problemów.

Polecam.

33637327.review:
(I will be as short as possible with this review.)
(I have clocked more hours on the CD versions than what Steam reflects.)

IL-2 Sturmovik: 1946 is a compilation release (2006) of IL-2 Sturmovik,Forgotten Battles, FB:Ace Expansion Pack, Pacific Fighters, and finally PE-2. The series begins in 2001 and has stretched into 2016 with the Battle of Stalingrad game with it's expansion the Battle of Moscow and a new IL-2 game "Battle  of Kuban is TBD.

What you need to know is that this is a wonderful series and I will not lie to you it is a very old game that may not run with Windows 10 and frankly that is to be expected considering it's age and how different Win10 is to other Win OS's.

If you want to fully experience this game to it's peak, you will need to dedicate bandwith and time to installing the BAT mod. It is a mod that contains five modules and two extra modules that allow you to play from WW1 up to Cold War era planes and missions. be warned that BAT. as of 2016-12-02 is around 60 GB in total with all modules downloaded. You can easily find Youtube videos of it but I will link the readers with the easiest way to aquire it. 

http://www.sas1946.com/main/index.php/topic,53512.0.html

If you don't want BAT that is fine and there are far smaller mods that are also high quality that not only improve visuals but improve the gameplay as well. Happy flying "ace".

And then promptly gets stuck in 50% of loading the files.

Oh, but that's not all! It also brings my computer to a screeching halt, making even the action of moving the mouse pointer a slow chore. If that wasn't bad enough, it also screws up the display of my monitor, creating a series of black lines from the middle of the screen to the right border, which come increasingly thick as they reach the righternmost part of the display.

I tried the regular fixes mentioned in this games discussion -running it in Windows XP SP2 compatibility mode, with admin rights and without some graphic options (which were disabled from the get-go, to begin with)- but no matter what I tried, I had the same results everytime, forcing me to restart my computer at least 5 times in the span of half an hour.

As I mentioned to the Steam representative when I claimed my refund: If the developers don't issue a patch/fix for this problem, it would be better for Steam to pull this from the store, since, as time goes by, it will become less and less compatible with newer computers, but many people will still hear great things about this game and will purchase it to try it out, only to become disappointed some minutes later.

-Commanderraf

31455621.review:
This is a long review for such a cheap game but I got my hopes up for nothing because people told me it was so much better than IL2 Cliffs of Dover, but little did I know.....

Sure this has 10x the amount of aircrafts and a massive list of huge maps, but the flying feels like an arcade game, you can't spot enemies from more than 1000m even when they are against the skyline and ESPECIALLY if your are higher than them unless you use the icons, which completley throws out any "realism" that was actually in the game.  This is not a flight simulation, there are no startup procedures, the only thing you can turn on to make it more realistic is engine overheating, but all you have to do to control it is keep your throttle at 90% and prop pitch at 80%.  The cockpit is very boxy and you feel like your face is smooshed against the sights unless you put your FOV all the way back which makes spotting even harder.  Shooting down aircraft is pretty easy, even agile planes are fairly stable and once you get one burst off, their engine will just catch on fire. 

Basically I'll put it like this.  If the only other flying game you've played is war thunder, then this is a step up for realism and you can have some fun.  If you've ever played Cliffs of Dover on realistic then this is a major step down.  Don't get me wrong though, even if the planes are easy to shoot down, they are still fun to blow up.  The mission editor is really good too so if you want you can just spawn in ~500m from an enemy already in the air and dog fight them.  But since the takeoff is so easy and all you have to do is press "I" to start your engine then there is no point in starting on the ground (unless you've only played war thunder).

As for bombing, I haven't tried it because my experience with the fighters was so god awful.  I watched a video though and it looked like the bombsight was the same as in war thunder.  All you have to do is press some buttons to adjust the sight, similar to sighting in a gun on Arma, kinda just a couple clicks and your good to go.

If it's on sale for like $2-5 then go for it but I'm just warning you, even with the massive amount of content, there's not much you can do since the planes all pretty much fly the same and taking off from a runway to travel anywhere to fight will be pretty useless unless there are like 10 planes because chances are you won't be able to spot just 1 or 2.  Taking off and bombing something might be fun but I assume it would get boring after a couple times since the maps are so big and there is no engine managment you have to do and I don't even know if theres a way to accuratly navigate, It would just be: Press "I", climb, turn on autopilot, switch to bomber and increase bomb sights, bombs away, done.  At least in Cliffs of Dover you have to do the whole startup, manage your engine, navigate correctly, and you'll actually be able to spot your target before your right on top of it.

To give you a quick comparison, I have like 30 hours or something close to that in Cliffs of Dover, and I still sometimes accidently crash a plane during take off or landing, but in this I have taken off and landed perfectly every single time...2 hours played...also shot down the enemy in like 1 minute my first dogfight.  One burst hit him and his propellar just stopped moving and his plane caught on fire...

29130118.review:
I had the original CD version of this game many years ago with many flight hours invested. When I found it on Steam and all the community interest in modding for it I immediately bought it.

This is one of the best WWII flights sims available even 10 years later. It has many aircraft, single missions and even multiple campaigns to choose from. Thanks to the modding community there are many comprehensive mod upgrades for this game. Graphics, sound and flight characteristic improvements in the community mods that make this game almost the visual eye-candy that IL-2: Battle of Stalingrad is. The thing about IL-2 1946 is it covers all aspects of WWII flight combat from The Battle of Britain, The Western Front, Africa, The Eastern Front and all the Pacific battles. There are many aircraft to choose from and with the community mods the aircraft fly and look spectacular. 

12.4.2 is the latest and probably last version of this game, which is what you get when you purchase this from steam. I personally use HSFX mod for this game and you can easily find download information on the net or through YouTube videos for install. It’s very easy and mainly just a few downloads and easy install instructions.

Make sure you have a flight stick. Even though you can fly without one its recommended. Take the time to setup your flight stick in-game and you will not be disappointed with this game. I run this game on my Windows 10 system with no problems at all.

This is positively a must have if you are a flight sim enthusiast, especially WWII.

28511074.review:
How may I briefly describe the many years of joy I've accumulated from this lovely and charming simulator?

I know she's long-in-the-tooth, and she's been through many missions, arrived back at base riddled and missing parts of her, but in no time I'm back with her, sitting knowingly in the cockpit:

She's my B-17 baby doll! My sexy P-38 Lightning!

My sassy Spitfire vixen over the white cliffs of Dover! 

She's my 109 and 190 dodging tracers over a Crimean Winter! 

She's my brave female Russian pilot in the versatile La-5FN!

She's the wingman to Sakai! Zeroing in with the Zero...

The Flying Tiger...

She's a Black Sheep in a Corsair!

Or she's an Me-262 jetting about tangling with the Cadillac of the sky, the famous P-51!

She's the Ilyusha! The Hunchback! The Flying Tank! The Flying Infantryman! She's the IL-2!

She's a pre-war warbird, an early warbird, mid-war warbird, late warbird, and a post-war warbird...

You can find her on all fronts in all factions. Graphically crusted, and with the Gremlins keeping mechanical failures to a minimum, and with a few MODifications, the IL-2 1946 engine is purring, staying alive for another mission over enemy territory.

27883268.review:
Still the best WW2 flight sim.

Especially with some of the mods that unlock numerous additional aircraft.

Even unmodded this is a spectacular game.

Yes it is a little dated now, but this can be largely rectified with some significant graphical improvements through the wonderful mods available.

Pros:

hundreds (yes hundreds) of different aircraft to fly
WW2 flight sims at their best
ludicrously cheap now
massive modding community - still very active
not a detailed sim like DCS

Cons:

vanilla game is graphically dated
lack of dynamic campaign (if this is what you are looking for - which I never was)
lack of well integrated multiplayer, see below
not a detailed sim like DCS

 Multiplayer - this game really predates the recent trend of multiplayer sim games. Hence it was not built around that as a concept. There are ways to undertake multiplayer, I believe, but I never did. I think there are better games for that such as the wonderful (and frustrating) warplanes.

Overall I give this a massive recommendation, if you want a ww2 flight sim that covers many planes to a light level of detail.

25928861.review:
Dies ist eine Review in der wenig auf Fehler geachtet wurde. bereitet euch auf eine menge Fehler vor.

Ein Spiel von 2006 zeigt heute immernoch 90% der Simulatoren wo der Hammer hängt. IL2 1946 ist immernoch einer der realsten und anspruchsvollsten Simulatoren. Selbst die Späteren ableger wie Battle of Stalingrad kommen nicht annähernd am Realismus an. ich kann lediglich  im LAN und gegen Bots teilen.

für den recht günstigen Preis von 10 Euro (oder bei keysites 3-4) bekommt man eine Anfängerfreundliche und zugleich Hardcore Simulation dank beliebig einstellender Effekte. Wind, Turbulenzen, Truddeln ist alles einstellbar. Start und Landung  werden dadurch auch durch eine echte Erfahrung auf höchsten schwierigkeits graden. Die schwierigkeit auf einfachsten grade kann man mit War Thunder RB vergleichen. auf Mittel schon fordernd. auf Experte wirste dich über jeden Kill Tierisch freuen. Kurz gesagt die Flug Physik fühlt sich bombastisch an. das Schadensmodell lässt sich auch sehen. man kann jedes Flugzeug sehr Detailreich zerlegen mit seiner Bewaffnung. man merkt jedes Loch den Flugmodell an. Für die Fanatiker unter euch kann man dann noch jedes kleine Detail vom Flugzeug Steuerbar machen. Gemisch, batterie und all das Zeug wo ich nie durchblicken würde alles einstellbar.

die Steuerung (erst Tastatur später Joystick gewechselt) ist selbst mit Tastatur ganz angenehm, trotz typischer Pfeiltastensteuerung. man kriegt erstaunlich gut was gerissen mit etwas übung auf leichteren Schwierigkeitsgraden. auf höheren schwierigkeitsgraden herrscht dann Joystickpflicht denn dort brauch man dann präzise und sanfte bewegungen da man sonst ins truddeln und weiteres kommt.

Flugzeuge...... zeigt mir ein Simulator der mehr bietet. ihr werdet ihn nicht finden. von 1930 bis 1945 ist eigentlich jedes bedeutende Flugzeug der Krieges dabei. es gibt sogar ein paar echte flieger aus dem jahre 1946 wie die P80 oder die Mig 9 aber auch ein paar Prototypen die es nur als Blaupause gibt wie die Ta 183 oder eine version der He 162. Mit weit über 200 Flugzeuge auf seiten der Allierten, der Wehrmacht, den Japanern und den Russen. also auch Britische, Italieänische und anderen Nationen sind dabei die zu den Allierten oder zur Wehrmacht gehörten. wem es aber dann doch zu wenig wird hat eine große auswahl an Mods. von 1 WK bis Moderne Jets ist alles dabei. wer also mal einen Nervenauftreibendem Fight mit 150 KMH in einer Holzmaschine haben will holt sich die flieger des 1WK. wer allerdings Taktisch mit Modernen equipment bei weit über 1000 KMH Kämpfen will kommt nicht an Flugzeuge wie die Su25, Mig 21, F18 und Co vorbei

jetzt (immerhin für viele ein NoGo) die Grafik. es ist von 2006 also erwartet nicht den schönsten ausblick der Welt. der Boden ist einfach nur ne flache Landschaft mit ein paar "Bäumen" oder viel zu kleinen Gebäuden. Die Flugzeuge sind aber Wesentlich Gut detalliert und darum geht es ja immerhin. Für mich ist die Grafik kein Problem aber es gibt ja so manche leute die erwarten von Spielen wie dieses das sie ausehen wie ein Film. wer ein schön aussehendes Spiel haben will sollte lieber zu IL-2 Battle of Stalingrad greifen was aber wesentlich unrealistischer ist und nicht annähernd soviel inhalt bietet.


Fazit:
+Realistische Physik (Flugmodell, Schaden)
+Eine Menge Flugzeuge
+Präzise Steuerung
+Leicht und Schwer zugleich

-Grafik 
-Musik (zumindets geht sie mir auf den.....)
-Multiplayer Tod
-Modding nicht leicht
-paar verbuggte Flieger wie die Bi-6.

Insgesamt ist es ein MUST HAVE für Flugzeugbegeisterte wie mich. dieses Spiel bietet mehr inhalt als die meisten Vollpreistitel jemals bieten werden und das für nur 10 euro.

I put in a lot of hours into this game in my younger years. I found this game is quite a big step of from Microsoft's Combat Flight Sim series. The developers really put their lives into making this game great while creating it. The variety and accuracy of the fighters is truly impressive. The aircraft sounds can be a little repetitive, however the game has quite a bit modding capability.

The quick scenario creator allows you to quickly create a mission in a logical and quick manner as opposed to Cliffs of Dover. Despite the older graphics engine, this game is a must have for any combat flight sim lover.

25164636.review: IL-2 Stumovik: 1946 really got me hooked, as in I played the game for 2 hours when I first got it. It's nothing like War Thunder, but instead better. For one, you can play offline against bots in 'Quick Mission Builder'. Two, with mods, you can fly the B-29 without having to spend 15 days online to unlock it [War Thunder, looking at you]. Some great mods to have with this is SAS Mod Loader, as well as AI Flyables. AIF allows you to fly the B-29, B-17, and even the Cherry Blossom [or 'Ohka'] kamikaze jet, as well as other aircraft. The damage modeling in this game could be better, eg. I was shooting a B-29 with the Me-262 [1946 version] and the wing just snapped right off like a twig. Also, you can't do any good crashes without skill, as in you'll explode if you flip upside down in a bomber on the ground. Overall, I rate this game a 9.5/10. Alright, I'm out. Peace.

25128881.review:
Written as of 25 August, 2016.

I grew up with this game, so I may be severely biased, just a warning. I remember getting the original IL-2 Sturmovik/Pacific Fighters pack way back in 2005 as a starry-eyed little kid. I was fascinated with aircraft from this era and it's the main reason I know how much about them I do today. And then, suddenly, this new, vastly superior version appeared! I never begged my parents for something so badly in my life, but I NEEDED this as a child. And so I made the money to buy it. Best idea ever. It doesn't show it, but the amount I have played this game in so many situations must easily be at least 4,000 hours before getting it on Steam alone. But enough of my life story, let's get into the review of this.

What makes this game appeal to someone like me? Vast amounts of aircraft stock in the game, hundreds of AI ground/naval vehicles to populate maps, and the fact that there's actually a very intuitive mission maker within the game itself. Throw in one of the newest massive modpacks (CUP/HSFX/DBW/etc.) and you're suddenly thrown into a game with hundreds of aircraft, amazing graphics, great missions, historical skins, and even more ground/naval cannon fodder. I greatly appreciate the attention to detail (especially for a game released in 2006) and historical value of this game. Some things aren't perfect, but hell, this was released almost a whole decade ago and is still rated as one of the best WWII Combat Flight Simulators out there.

Well, that's great and all, but what are some dislikes? Well, I would say the graphics are fairly bad, but I cut it major slack for being made in 2006. There's also the incessant lawnmower for 90% of stock aircraft engines. Plus that music. I love the original 2003 vibes of the original and Pacific Fighters combined, but after playing both for 11 years, that has gotten under my skin to the point of muting the music. Some of the controls are difficult to master, and the game itself takes years to master. Hell, when I first started the series, it pissed me off. The tutorials and such are honestly shoddy and you really can't play this well without a joystick, but with even a low quality one in your hands, you can become proficient. All of my dislikes besides the joystick near-necessity (not really a complaint in my opinion) are with the stock game, and mods 100% cure all.

Pros:
Held up to time amazingly well
Can be very relaxing
Amazing 3D models (for the time)
Great flight characteristics
In-game mission editor
Millions of options for custom missions
Near-overwhelming amounts of mods due to roughly 10 communities, creating a very customizable environment

Cons:
Graphics (Can be easily modded)
Sounds and Music (Again, mods)
Lack of hands-on tutorials
Almost requires joystick (But it's a simulator, not some arcade game)

Overall:
9/10. My all-time favorite WWII FCS, and one I've easily sunk thousands of hours into before adding to Steam. Supreme amounts of replay value, obscene amounts of content, and the best installment (personal opinion) in the series that set the foundation for modern WWII Flight Combat Simulation games to this day.

24577473.review:
Recommendation with a big asterisk.

Il-2 isn't for everyone. It's not really a game but rather a WWII combat flight simulator with incredible depth and a large selection of available planes that come with great mechanical detail. Before you purchase or play this game you need to be prepared for that. Furthermore you have to prepared for the fact that there is no easy way in. You will need to spend several hours before you can even hit an enemy once. If you don't have a big interest in WWII warbirds from both sides there's nothing to keep you intrigued other than the gameplay which is incredibly customizable and deep though.

Enter the big asterisk. Everything you get from the game is what you bring into it. There's no storyline, no interesting campaign, just no character to any of it, nothing to welcome you into the world of historical air combat. The "training" is laughable and the included missions are plain boring and uninspired. Unless you want to delve deep into the mission editor you're lost, the quick mission builder is less than stellar. The community is not very helpful either when it comes to modding the 15 year old engine so with every aspect of Il-2 you're basically left to your own devices. With a little effort from the developers this could have been a wonderful experience for a wider audience. Much older games like the Red Baron series have shown what an immersive campaign mode can add to a simulator. 

I can still recommend Il-2 though based on its mechanical strength and commendable wealth of content. Ever since my earliest childhood I've been a hardcore airplane nerd and just being able to fly my fantasy league of planes into combat with my entire keyboard scattered with shortcuts is enough to recommend this simulator to like-minded inviduals with too much time on their hands. Everyone else will be left standing in the rain. You will need patience, dedication and a good joystick and even then it's no guarantee you will like it. I can't blame anyone who never got into Il-2, personally I fell asleep playing similarly deep and realistic games like the Arma series.

For those who are complaining this game is unplayable without a joystick: no sh*t, this is not war thunder.

24039548.review:
[h1]Basic Information[/h1]
[b]Title:[/b]  IL-2 Sturmovik 1946
[b]Developer:[/b]  1C: Madd0x Games
[b]Publisher:[/b]  iC-777
[b]Genre:[/b]  Flight Simulator

[h1]General Impression[/h1]
Sturmovik 1946 is one of the best WW2 combat flight sims in recent years and I have been playing it in one version or another, almost since its launch. In its current 1946 edition, you have a whopping number (229) of planes to choose from as well as dynamic campaigns for almost every theatre of operations from that war. The amount of setting customization is also an integral part of this game. You can never claim that it might be too difficult since you can tweak the options until you play an almost arcade version. And yet, this title is best played on a flightstick. The mouse and keyboard do a decent job, but they are far from ideal and this game takes some time getting used to, especially with the taking off and landing parts (both skippable). Age had taken its toll on the general aspect, but Sturmovik 1946 is far from bland looking and the sound score fits the game perfectly.

[h1]Strong Points[/h1]
+ Nice graphical details.
+ Excellent diversity in both missions/campaigns and in the airplanes themselves.

[h1]Weak Points[/h1]
- No Steam Trading Cards or Achievements.

[b]Rating 9/10[/b]

SHORT VERDICT

IL-2 is one of my favorite flight simulator games of all time, I still owned the game on disk. When I saw it on steam I knew I had to get it and so far im not dissapointed. Im running Windows 10 and i've encounered no problems with it, I hope it's the same case for you if your looking to purchase.

Another heads up is that there is no mouse joy (you can't use a mouse to fly), that's fine for me beacuse I have a joystick but you will need either that or a controller (if supported). You will also need to have a thorough look at the controls. The game can be very difficult at times, remember to find FOV (Field of View) in the options menu and set bind keys to increase or decrease the FOV. Also have a look at the difficulty setting, there you can change things like blackouts and redouts, realistic pilot damage, head shake, etc. If you are in a struggle tweak around at the settings.

Graphics still sort of hold up, its really not bad, there is no shading or ambient occulsion but still manages to look good. Just remeber to run the game with OpenGL, as it looks much better! (In options menu) When you first get into the game set up the game with the controls and setting you want. then head into either the tutorials or head into quick mission builder, here you can pick where you want to fly, who you want to fight and you can choose from a large variety of planes. There are a total of 4 nations to choose from.

If you are looking to buy this game, I hope this will help you, the only reason I made this "review" is because I saw people raging in the reviews cus they had no idea what was going on. Anyways IL-2 is still a lot of fun to this day and I still enjoy a battle now 'n then. I love this game and hope you will too.

23515012.review:
I'd been flying for the better part of an hour over endless, shimmering blue waves before they came into sight. At first I thought it might be just a trick of my brain, as I had been straining my eyes toward the horizon for a long time. But no, it's not my imagination, there are the faintest shadows against the sky in the hazy blue distance. First just a few, then more, and as I fly closer they elongate and begin to take shape. A squadron of heavy bombers, at least 20 of them by looks of it, and they are on their way to drop a hundred thousand pounds of high explosives on our airbase. Well, not if I have anything to say about it.

I pull back on the stick, climbing above the scatted, puffy-white stratus clouds and putting the incoming bombers a few thousand feet further below me. I let them come sliding underneath, and then I roll left and dive. The Gs push me back into my seat and I feel the blood rush from my head but I modulate my dive to avoid losing consciousness. In what feels like a matter of a few heartbeats I drop out of the clouds behind the squadron and get the tail-most bomber in my sights. The tailgunner has seen me and he opens fire, but its too late. A short burst from my cannons sets their right engine on fire. Another burst and the wing snaps like a twig in a gale, the bomber pitches sharply up and then topples over to the left. Thus begins their death spiral down into the sea below, a trail of black smoke highlighting the bomber's final path. I see a few white parachutes open along that trail of smoke but the helpless bomber crew no longer interest me. I'm getting near enough to the next bomber that their gunners start to open up, and white phosphorous tracer rounds are streaking past my cockpit glass. Cool, calm, collected... I feel the exhilaration of the kill but I ride the adrenaline smoothly. My hand rests lightly on the stick, my feet adjust the rudder ever-so-gently, and the swaying of the plane around me is like an extension of my arms and legs. The second bomber's left engine is in my sights and I squeeze the trigger....


10/10 Would stalk enemy bombers again.

22736415.review:
Alright, don't let my game time lie to you, I use a third-party program in order to use a control with it, so let's get right into this review. 

I'll start this off with, this might be one of the greatest World War 2 games I've ever played, and it is also very high up there on the best games I've ever played. This game has everything a good World War 2 dogfight game should have, and everything that its closest modern competitor, War Thunder, doesn't have. First, it has good controller compatibility (using outside mods, but still). Another thing that I cannot emphasize enough on, is the career. You can select from any country that had a flying airplane (and was important), and you can create your pilot, select your rank, earn rewards, and rank up. It's all pretty crazy. Now, I can't rate the multiplayer due to the fact that I haven't tried it, so I'm going to skip to the mission builders. Now, there are two kinds of mission builders, quick and full. Now, think of quick as sort of your instant action, you select your opponents, select your plane, select the number, select the map, and play. There is a couple additional features, like the mission type or the altitude, but those aren't as important. Then there is the full mission builder, the spot that I've spent the majority of my time in. You can select from a huge number of maps, then deploy the planes, artillery, boats, buildings, trains, bunkers, cars, motorcycles, etc. The list goes on. You then deploy waypoints and ya'll battle it out. It truely is amazing, for an early 2000s game, like 2001 or something is when it came out. This comes with a bunch of DLCs and additional content for only $10.
Graphics
Aged very well. They are not bad, they are in the middle, but they still look fine for when it was made. 


TL:DR 
Gameplay - 9/10
Content - 10/10 
Graphics - 7/10
Mission builder - 11/10 
Overall - 92.5% Which is practically an A-.

I may be overselling this game a little bit, but it is just plain amazing (haha get it?). I highly advise you buy it, unless you don't have a controller or flight stick, then don't buy it. If you're using a controller, download one of the many keyboard and mouse to controller programs like this: http://pinnaclegameprofiler.com/
Have fun and be Germany, they have sweet planes.
Such as the Me-262 with the 50mm cannon.
Yes.
50mm.

22610580.review:
Probably 10 years ago, I was heavily invested in the IL-2 franchise, with both "Aces" and "Forgotten Battles" expansions, and later the "Pacific Fighters" module. It just BARELY ran on my cheap, office desktop, and i had issues with the CPU overheating because of this game, but I played anyway because it was AMAZING. I had always been a fan of the WW2 flight sims from Microsoft, but this was a cut above. I really felt like I was IN the plane, not on a simulator. 

I had heard a lot of people saying that 1946 wouldnt work on Win 10. Recently, I heard a large number of people had success getting it to run. Since I hadn't enjoyed the game in 6-8 years, I dropped my $10 on trying it - and was blown away by how well it held up! See, I had just bought IL-2 Battle of Stalingrad a week prior, and was (still am) in love with it. However, I loved reading about all the old planes as a youngster, and to be able to fly 229 of the most famous, and the most obscure, aircraft of the era is like a dream come true. 

The only gripe some may have are the interior visuals - they look very dated. They are, however, immersive, and entirely 3d, so It isn't unplayable. The exterior visuals really hold up well. If you compare it to BoS or Even "Rise of Flight" you can tell it's a bit older, but it still looks good. The worst textures come from ground units - tanks, jeeps, AA positions, all look like theyre from the 1990's, but since you won't see them for more than a second, I really don't notice.

If you're a Win 10 user, thinking about trying the more expensive BoS, maybe give this a try - I find myself playing it more than its hotter, newer sibling.

:::UPDATE:::

I ordered a USB Bluetooth adapter for my PC, as I play several controller-based games also. I neglected to remove my controller from both the USB charging cable, and the bluetooth device manager, and it ultimately deactivated my joystick. Once I realized the error, and removed my PS4 controller from the computer entirely, my joystick began to work again. Simply a word of caution to avid gamers.

While certainly is showing its age, it still has its strengths; such as an impressive number of available aircraft built up over the years. Where-as most games only come with a mere handful, this sim comes with literally hundreds of WW2 aircraft – and through 3rd party modification (such as [url=http://www.sas1946.com/main/index.php/board,241.0.html]CUP[/url]) there is hundreds and hundreds more, not just for WW2, but for WW1 through to modern. The flight models of these aircraft are also really well done – even by today’s standards. Plus it has to be said for the vast majority of these planes there is few to no alternative simulators where you will be able to fly them all in one package without huge expense or comprising flight model accuracy - at least until the newer IL-2 games have been expanded over time.

Multiplayer is tricky but certainly functional and the game runs fine for me on Windows 10, but a certainly better experience with mods installed. If you have interest in WW2 aviation, or aviation in general then for the price of £6.99 for literally hundreds and hundreds of available aircraft to fly, you should have this title in your library.

20359317.review:
I've only recently buy the steam version, however, I've been flying in IL-2, 1946 for 8 years now, so don't let the playing time fool you.

This is one of the best, if not outright the best, civilian-grade combat flight simulator one can find these day. Although some other, like Battle of Stalingrad, has better graphic and physics (it's almost a decade now, of course physics gonna be improved), none have the same feeling, planes diversity, combat diversity, location, as 1946 has to offer. The flight sim itself can be set to multiple level of realism, allowing new rookies to take control with confident while learning to fly with easy flying mode, and allowing hardcore ace to feel the wind flow through the wing, to feel the recoil, and to feel the aircraft itself with full realistic setting.

Okay, what I mean "easy mode" is that it's a simplified mode. It's not a face-pace arcade mode like War Thunder. The mission is the same as full realistic setting, only simplified some matter, like no spinning. Also, no aiming helper either. If you're looking for War Thunder's alternative, you're coming the wrong way. IL-2 1946 is far more realistic than War Thunder.

Beside, another advantage is that they're freaking LOTS OF PLANES!!! More than 10 of Yak-9 subtype, 20 of Spitfire's subtype, dozen of A6M family, lots of Bf-109, etc, most come as realistic as you could find, and some paper planes are also fitted well within the game. Which mean you could made an alternate scenario mission with these plane if you like.

Oh, did I mention large amount of mods avalable? Some of them give a new graphic, some add EVEN MORE PLANES, some hoes as far as Korean war (heard that someone made an F-86H with Sidewinder as well), and lots of possibility.

So, if you want a not-so-hard flight sim, with low graphic requirement, lots of planes, and adaptability, I personally recommend this sim for you.

Safe flying, everyone.
Dr. Galactose

[h1]Лучшая из лучших игра в серии авиасимуляторов)[/h1]
Впервые с авиасимулятором я познакомился еще аж в 2005 году. Тогда это был MS Flight Simulator 3. У меня была днюха и  бабушка подарила мне кругленькую сумму (мелкий был еще). Ну вот пошел в магазин и купил диск. Пришел домой и читаю, что написано на коробке из под диска:  [i]"По уровню графики MS Flight Simulator практически догнал Ил-2, один из самых красивейших симуляторов..." [/i].И тут я подумал "А не дурень ли я, что купил какое-то дер*мо, а не ИЛ-2?" В тот же день пошел и обменял. Но сначала установил тот. И только потом пошел и поменял (ой, только не говорите, что так не делали))
Ну и конечно было с чем сравнить. 

[list]
   [*]Графика действительно (даже сейчас) остается на высшем уровне.
   [*]Уровень сложности управления можно изменять (от легкого, где самолетом сможет управлять даже ребенок, и до сложного, для опытных любителей погонять железных птиц)
   [*]Огромный "+" в изменениях режимов стрельбы (уровень сложности здесь также регулируется. Например от ракет в режиме "Как в жизни" ваш самолет смело может развернуть на 45 градусов)
   [*]Также большой выбор самолетов. Кажется, что они повторяются. Но на самом деле у каждого свои преимущества и недостатки (У КАЖДОГО. БЕЗ ИСКЛЮЧЕНИЙ)
   [*]Выбор вооружений тоже приятно порадовал. От разрывных пулеметов, до 1000фт. бомб и торпед.
   [*]Кстати, хочу вернуться к графике. Если поставить все на максималках, то особо радуют облака и океан) Я обожаю тему с короблями. И когда их торпедируешь, они прикольно тонут.
   [*]Огромные города, которые можно бомбить, когда нечем заняться. Можно полностью разрушить, чтоб все полыхало)
   [*]Конечно, нельзя не затронуть тему с боями. Иногда противники бывают слишком хитры и ты просто не успеваешь их растрелять. 18410193.review:
What did we get here from the old box of games? IL-2 Sturmovik: 1946 it is!

IL-2 Sturmovik: 1946 is a classic WWII plane simulator with many planes to fly. If you'd ever like a classic dogfight with a friend, this game is good. It is also a good game for stuff like LAN-parties as it can host servers on LAN-only.

This game might be really old, but it is just an absolute gem. It works on new computers (tested on Windows 10 and a gaming PC bought in the beginning of 2015, works perfectly fine in Full HD resolution). The game can literally work on any calculator you own as it is like 10 years old.

Don't let that fool you though, this is quite a good plane simulator. To start up your plane, you need to do a lot of stuff before going into the skies. Physics can be as realistic as you want them to be. Unrealistic physics are the most fun, since can bounce into the sea and still fly, but realism mode changes all that except graphics-wise.


Conclusion:


+ Both realistic and unrealistic can be amazing in their own ways
+ Runs basically on any computer that uses Steam
+ Compatible with new screens
+ Hilarious glitches
+ Great choice of WWII planes and even prototypes
+ Great for LAN-parties

- Quite an old game
- Graphics are not the best in the world
- Unrealistic mode glitches are fun, but sometimes not fun for your opponents
- Render problems at some points (just check my oil lake pictures, that is meant to be a river and a lake)


I CAN recommend this game to anyone who likes their plane simulators, but not everybody will like this ancient gem. I'll leave it up to you, as I DO have more positive points than negative ones, but the negative ones are more significant.

This game is probably one of the best combat flight sims i have played.

There is a steep learning curve, the training videos don't do much to help,  you basically have to figure out how to fly on your own.  The aircraft selection is massive so there is bound to be something you'll like flying. (my personal favourite is the Spitfire Mk.IX series. ) You can change the difficulty settings to configure the game from a semi-realistic flight game to a hardcore sim.  In the Campaigns (some of which are dynamic) you can find yourself dogfighting over the lakes of Finland, intercepting bombers over Stalingrad, operating from carriers at Midway, escorting B-29s over Japan and much more.

The game is old so the Graphics aren't insane but gameplay-wise it's awesome.

Despite most the negative reviews, you do not need any kind of specialist equippment like Joysticks, Rudder pedals or Track IR.  My friend, Shas'O Bongosun, (who has flown over 200 hours in the game.) only uses keyboard and mouse and he's a good pilot. 17463252.review:
IL-2 Sturmovik: 1946 is a game unlike many, and this can be for better or for worse. If you get this game, one of the first things that you will notice about it, is that it isn't exactly the easiest game to learn to like. The tutorials that are available to you do not put you at the controls of the aircraft you're being taught to fly, but rather make you watch another person fly it the way it's supposed to be flown. Really, the only true way you can learn to play the game is to start it up, and begin playing it immediatly. No tutorials, no help. Trust me, you will die. A lot.

I'm going to go ahead and tell you the things that you likely won't like about this game at first. 1: There are no "Real" tutorials that teach you how to play as I've said before, meaning the only way for you to learn to play the game is through jumping right in.

2: The controls and flight characteristics are very realistic, meaning that if you haven't played a Flight Simulator before, there are hundreds of ways that you can screw yourself over without actually getting into combat, such as putting yourself into a Flat Spin, Stalling Out, Ripping Your Wings, Overheating Your Engine, etc.

3: There can literally be a use for every single button on your keyboard, meaning that hitting one wrong button can mean instant death.

4: This game is unbelievably difficult to master in terms of everything, from flight controls to maneuvers to landing.

With all of these negativities said, it doesn't sound like a very fun game, now does it? That's where you're wrong. I believe that the people that made this game were absolute geniuses. This is the number one thing about this game - you need to be patient. You will die several times before actually learning to kill anything, but once you do learn, once the little mechanism inside your brain clicks with this game, it will be one of the most fun World War Two Flight Simulators you've ever played. 

The Bottom Line is, this game isn't for people that give up easily. This game is for people who are patient, and people who are willing to learn. Do I recommend this game? Yes, yes I do, but only if you are willing to learn the complexities of it. If not, then don't waste your time with it.

With Hyperlobby providing custom dedicatd servers with custom gamemodes and a clan servers that are still active to this day. 16137810.review:
This is a great flight combat simulator, maybe the best out there. 
The graphics are kind of outdated because its not a new game, but still good and rounded, the airplanes are very nice modelled, landscape are simple but cool, effects are not bad.  Panels and Hud are not special but you have lot of views to choose from.

The strong point of this game is when it comes to simulate the typical features of this kind of combat and this aviation era. You can see realistic aerodynamics, ballistic trajectory,  angle of attack stalls, overheat, spins ( you need to know how to proper get out or it will spin until hit the ground ), torque effect, potential energy, and much more.  The hitboxes and damage effect also works great.  You have a enormous variety of planes and targets to choose from, and every plane have their own characteristics.  There many other cool features.

The only downside for me is the campaign, because it´s take so many time and are not something that catch you and get you evolved, i just don´t feel like it is a campaign.   But i had a lot of fun doing custom missions, and multiplayer can be real exciting and challenging.

IL2 have a lot of option to setup the game more easy and friendly, but in cost of the realism of course, i´d rather play it "as real as it gets".
You will NEED a joystick to play, as any flightsim, but this in special, without a good stick this game can be really disappointing.

The controls and commands are very simple, no secret..   

If you like WW2 aviation era, and want a realistic simulator that you need to spend a lot of time to learn until you get proficient, this is the way to go.

If you just want to do crazy stunts and frag some enemies right of the box then forget it.

IL-2 Stumovik 1946 8/10 - Graphics are not as pretty as newer games that is why i don't give it a 10/10

The best flight sim I have ever played.  It is a shame that BoS and CloD failed to deliver.  All they had to do was take the original game and make the graphics pretty.  The details and amount of content in IL-2 Sturmovik 1946 is far superior.  The community is small but strong.  The problem is that there are so many mods for the game that the community is split up.   I was so hoping that these new titles would unite the community under one patch and allow these games to thrive.  Unfortuanetly they were unable to deliver so i find my self playing a 11 year old game that is better then anything out there.

We can't really blame the devs for everything the die hard community is very demanding.  I think 1946 hit a perfect balance of engine managment that neither of these new games do well.  None of the settings for the engine managenemt in 1946 would cause you to blow the engine unless you ran it full  throttle and let if over heat or played with the prop pitch and over spun the engine.... there was engine managment but very little of it was engine breakering unless you were really pushing the limits. CloD i can't take off without blowing a gasket or perforating a radiator and I don't know why which just makes it so frustrating that I have no interest in learning, so only the die hards will play this game so the community will be small which will make the Devs little money and low motive to update or release patches.  This can already be seen as the community of die hards has taken this over releasing their own patches for the game.

Bottom Line is I am just disapointed and will have to wait many more years for a decent flight sim to come out and actaully push my graphics card and wow my senses.  (It will probably be BoS or CloD once the community patches the crap out of them, currently leaning towards BoS as per reasons above)

IL-2 1946 - Angefangen als eine Studie über die legendäre IL-2 des 2. Wer War Thunder oder World of Warplanes gut findet, wird IL-2 lieben, es sei denn er kommt mit der anfänglichen Schwierigkeit nicht klar kommt und das Spiel viel zu voreillig in die Ecke tut. Dieses Spiel ist kein kurzfristiger Spaß, sondern einer den man sich erarbeiten muss. Ich vergleiche es deshalb gerne mit Dark Souls der Simulatoren, wo jeder Funke Freude, sei er auch nur so klein, hart erarbeitet werden muss, wodurch dieses Spiel aber auch gleichzeitig so belohnend ist. 

Wer mit Flugzeugsimulatoren noch nicht viel zutun, hatte sollte dennoch zulangen, da das Spiel spottbillig aktuell verkauft wird und auf gog noch billiger für gerademal 4€~.
Wenn es Fragen gibt können, diese gerne gestellt werden, so auch Anfragen zu Multiplayern etc., da ich mit anderen Piloten einen Server betreiben, mit eigenem Mumble (sowas wie TS³) und eigenen Tools für das Spiel. Modsupport ist auch gegeben und auch persönliche Skins, wodurch das gemeinsame Spielen noch unterhaltsamer wird.

14447397.review:
什么是一款优秀的空战模拟游戏？答案是肯定的，就是空战环节做的优秀。这部作品经历了十几年的发展到现在包含200多种二战飞机，以及东线，西线，太平洋等战场，完整优秀的编辑系统，涂装编辑，地图编辑。动态战役，无线电导航，等等都是可以交给玩家自己去创作。不仅如此，民间还衍生出了许多不同的版本。如我国dof的sa版本，德粉制作的up系列（目前up3）。以及hsfx等版本 ，还有各式各样的飞机插件，模组供玩家娱乐。这是真正把主动权交给玩家。
     
     在游戏中玩家可以逼真感受到真实飞行员的所感受到的一切，这得益于il2的制作重点：空战。目前此款il2是公认的飞行手感最接近真飞机的，好多飞行俱乐部平时就拿il2来做练习使用。当然个版本具体有些差异。飞机控制采用简化办法，如襟翼统统都是分档，飞机无需冷启动之，直接一键启动。航电方面比较弱，但是必要的无线电等都有。这使玩家专注于飞行任务而不是各种开关。另外画面经过调整也是很棒的，尤其光影方面。简单明了的色彩更容易使玩家SA观察。
  
    与其它款主流飞行游戏相比，唯一弱点也就是画面了。损伤方面考虑的是相比其他要少很多。简单明了并不是错，好多人说bos好，好在哪里？计算飞机各个零件的损伤那只是飞行中的最后一步，如果前面各方面都没做好那要这精细的计算有何用。自从民间制作组接手后一直在默默的黑德机，但这并不是拒绝这款游戏的理由。目前什么游戏都在黑德机（CLOD基本上没有。）不过也难怪，模拟飞行好多都是毛子做的。但是就是从尊重历史的方面这也是不妥的吧。

   模拟飞行已经可以不算是游戏了，我更愿意叫他软件，在学习的过程中，翻阅资料，切磋探讨等都将是受用无穷的。因为模拟飞行都是建立在真实航空理论上的。

14233736.review:
My hours are a bit wrong on this one, as i have previously owned the Disk version of il-2 Sturmovik: Forgotten battles and Pacific Fighters when they first came out. 

My god is this game great. Whether its making your own Career as a fighter over Stalingrad, or making your own Insane missions in the great mission builder, this game is the best Combat Flight sim i have ever played.

Dynamic campaigns mean you'll never quite have the same mission twice (Although alot of the times you'll be doing the same thing depending on your aircrafts role, but in different locations against different amounts and types of enemys) while still getting in Historic battles such as Stalingrad, Berlin, or Midway (And everything between). If thats not your thing or you feel its too repeatative, then check out the mission editors.

Quick Mission Builder is an easy and fast way of making anything from Bombing missions to straight up massive dogfights. You simply just choose what aircraft you want to fly and how many squadmates and your Allies and Enemys, Pick the loadouts, skins, and countries. (You can fly an American plane as a German if you want) Then get into the action and deal with whatever you threw at yourself.

Full mission builder is a bit different.....and i mean alot different. You control every aspect of basically anything. Control weather, time, Cloud height and make buildings and objects. You want a plane to take off, fly to somewhere along a specific route and altitude? Done. You want to patrol something? Done. Do you want Tanks and AA guns on the ground supporting or making your own Ground offensive? Done! You can even position Static cameras for those moments you just want to sit back and watch the carnage. Blow up and damage cities with a simple slider and clicks. Hell you can make planes Kamikaze things if you do it right. One of my personal favorites is to make roughly 50 aircraft, Fighers, Bombers, whatever, and fly them straight it to a massive area filled with AA guns and just try to survive for as long as you can while watching shit get blown up.

All and all i would give it a 10 out of 10. The only big downside i see is that there is alot of planes you cant fly, (there is still a good number of flyable ones though ;3 ) but i know there is mods out there that will litterally make everything flyable and even add more. Fuck you can get Atomic bomb mods if you want. The modding comunity is amazing.

Anywho thats enough of my rant. My god have i typed alot. 10/10 and Thank you if you took the time to read my rambling.

14027228.review:
31 march 15 update: THIS GAME IS UP AND WORKING AGAIN:  With a tweak...once you've installed it, right click on the game name, scroll down to properties, then choose BETAS. Then select old_version, ignore the code box, then apply. It'll start!


An oldie but a goodie!

IL-2 Sturmovik has developed from an Eastern Front ww2 flght sim into an absolute monster! It's detailed, unforgiving at times, takes effort to get into, and has a steep learning curve. Despite, or because of all of that, it's an awesome game. Given it's pretty old now, most mid range systems will do well with this. The graphics were good for its time, and still hold up ok in the sky. 

There's a huge online community of verteran players making all sorts of custom missions and skins for this game. Skins are easy to import. 

These days there's plenty of action for the other fronts of WW2 as well, especially in the Pacific.

Damage is well modelled, flight characteristics have been well researched, with only a few glitches, and aircraft interiors are beautifully done. Oleg , the man who started all this, was insistent that no aircraft be imported until the cockpit was fully accurate.

I'd recommend this for someone who has an interest in flight from this era, and is willing to put in the hours to learn to fly adequately. I'd suggest starting not in your favorite aircraft, but something more forgiving like an IL-2 to learn to fly. Eventually you'll be able to handle other aircraft no problem. Landing is a big challenge, I've played over 2000 hours on this game back in its CD only days and I'm still  more nervous about landing than combat!

There's also some "what if?" aircraft included, hence the title 1946. They're fun, and make for an interesting experience, but don't add to the realism. There's some fascinating player made 1946 missions out there well worth playing.

This is not for the casual gamer. I can't stress this enough. This game demands your attention and your commitment. do so and it'll reward you. A number of real-life veterans have said this game captures the difficulty of ww2 air combat. Don't expect an easy ride.

I opened the game. I started a bombing sight tutorial, didn't listen and went strait into the game as a Ju87 Stuka against some Russian bomb targets. Going in, I didn't really know the controls, but I let the autopilot spend the 2 minutes it took to get to the targets. After a short 30 seconds, the other stukas had already dropped their payloads, I didn't know how to but I was told the mission was complete. I was still flying however.

We were then suddenly surprised to see a small fighter group of Ishaks close in on us from the ground. I thought this would be a good opportunity to learn a bit about the dogfighting. So, I dive in the mighty Stuka, hoping to boom and zoom a lowly Ishak.

After about 15 seconds, I got one on screen. I fought for a good while with my plane to stay on target, line the sights up, get in range, stay far enough away for the bullets to hit him, and also fight the speed of the Stuka in a dive. I then lined the Isak up and...

I heard the machine guns roar as bits of the Ishak's wing went flying by when I suddenly got about 500 messages from other pilots;

"Two is hit!"  "I down!"  "Need assistance..."

And then I was shot and my fuel tank exploded, shutting off my engine. I tried desperately to force the damned Stuka to the mainland and crash "safely", but to no avail. I bailed out at 300 metres and was shot by an enemy pilot. Real damn honorable.

10/10 would fail again.

13629604.review:
"Il-2 Sturmovik: 1946" originally began as an Eastern Front flight combat simulator which branched into Europe, The Pacific and then into the immediate Post-war Jet era. It has become a bit of a cult following with several loyal players continually playing, hosting, creating skins, missions and campaigns. 

It is probably one of the longest running dedicated combat sims which though using a limited and dated engine, is still able to satisfyingly emulate the widest scope of aviation combat centered around World War 2 in varying difficulty levels and complexity. It has over 150 flyable aircraft from varying aspects of nearly all theaters of operations as well as associated maps. It includes pilot campaigns from nearly all sides, a quick mission builder and a full mission builder. But most of it's contemporary strengths come from beautifully made skins, missions, campaigns and utilities from it's many followers and fans that run the gamut of historical to flights of fantasy. 

It's latest version is 4.12.2m (which is the latest steam version - No patching needed!) which has been officially updated by a group called Team Daidalos (rumor has it they are even working on 4.13!) has added flyable aircraft, tweaked graphics and sounds and additional mission building options and objects. (it even now has the option to add 3rd party "Online sounds" and still be a 'stock' game) It's multiplayer capability is via Hyperlobby where you can usually fly and/or host missions, join dedicated server maps, or get limited help from people there.

Besides the stock game, many have added one of the popular mods to add even more popular aircraft, different flight models, digitized sounds, improved graphics and mission building options and objects. (Most mods can be switched to stock easily via a simple program).

It has the added advantage of being able to run smoothly (A critical point in combat flight sims) on most older systems.

oh, I have purchased 2 retail box versions and the steam version so I've played a bit more than 10 minutes..  :)

(I have "Il-2:Cliffs of Dover" and "Il-2: Battle of Stalingrad" and I [i]still[/i] enjoy "Il-2 Sturmovik:1946)

13180779.review:
Conheço o IL-2 desde que ele foi lançado por volta de 2001 ou 2002. Já tinha reparado que os gráficos do jogo eram excepcionais para a época e a jogabilidade prometida parecia ótima. Ainda assim, nunca consegui aprender a jogar direito. Naquele tempo, eu mal sabia uma palavra de inglês e não conseguia entender praticamente nada nos tutoriais. Logo, qualquer dificuldade para aprender a jogar podia se dever à minha incapacidade para entender os tutoriais.

Comprei o jogo novamente este ano com a esperança de jogar o que não pude há cerca de dez anos. Embora os gráficos dos cenários estejam muito aquém dos padrões atuais, os aviões ainda são bastante detalhados e bem modelados até para os jogos de hoje. Já quanto à jogabilidade, eu diria que o jogo é realista até demais. Isso não deveria ser um problema, até porque poderia ser facilmente resolvido com os tutoriais (que, hoje, já consigo compreender). A grande questão é que há milhões de tutoriais e aparentemente todos são apresentações de, no mínimo, dez ou quinze minutos mostrando como pilotar o avião, sem dar nenhuma chance para você fazer na hora o que está sendo ensinado ali. Se você tiver (MUITO) tempo e paciência para assistir às apresentações e ficar testando o que aprendeu no jogo propriamente dito, recomendo comprar este pacote. Agora, se você não tiver (meu caso), garanto que você não vai conseguir pilotar nada. Qualquer manobra com o avião faz com que ele entre em estol (stall ou perda de sustentação) e caia. Você pode até desabilitar o estol e outros milhões de possíveis problemas aerodinâmicos. Isso vai fazer com que o jogo fique menos realista, mas garanto que o avião não vai ficar tão mais fácil de pilotar. Por isso, não recomendo.

13180643.review:
Despite being a bit dated, IL-2 Sturmovik: 1946 is still a top notch flight sim. The game had a number of substantial updates since its release, with the most recent being just last year (2013), though I'm not so certain if the game will see as much now with Battle of Stalingrad on the table. A plus in my book, some aircraft that have multiple crew stations can be manned by human players in multiplayer, so there's a possibility you can even get friends who don't care for flying to join in.

 If you're looking for a solid World War 2 to 1946ish era flight sim, this is a safe pick and you especially can't really go wrong with it if you get it on sale. If you're new to the flight sim scene, I would suggest trying the A6M but be careful of your dive speed. If you excede 350mph, you could cause damage to the airframe --even to where the wings tear off...

Edit ( undated ) : I was just thinking about this review the past few days and it occurred to me that I should mention (emphasize) that this game is a flight sim and not an arcade style flyer. A flight stick is highly recommended for this game because flying with mouse and keyboard is going to give you a pretty lousy experience.

Edit ( 2017/06/28 ) :
 I haven't looked at this review in a while but the game came up in conversation recently and I thought I would check on the status of its updates. Steam only updates the game to 4.12.2m while  C1 has released patches up to 4.13.3m with a smaller fix in 4.13.4 (see Link 2)

  - I don't keep up with the online community but apparently 4.12.2m has the largest selection of mod packs and I don't know what the majority of online servers are running. The best thing to do in that regard is to do some research on your own and decide what direction you want to go.

13172367.review: Hellooo. I used to have IL-2 Forgotten Battles, but I decided to replace it with this. I have only played a little bit, but I think it is enough to write this review. Buying the thing was pretty simple but I had problems starting the game up. It was extremely frustrating but I submitted my problem to Steam Support, got an answer instantly,  followed the instructions that they gave me and it worked perfectly. IL-2 is of course getting old, but it has it's advantages. It plays very smoothly on my computer (A windows 7 that is kinda clogged with stuff that has built up over the years) and you get more options than newer sims. I thought this would be a good purchase instead of a newer one, since I get so many aircraft. IL-2 Sturmovik Battle of Stalingrad (recently released) is a great, high-end sim, but you can only fight with Russian and German planes and during the same time of year and the same location. This was a better option for me because I can fly what I feel like flying. Just today I reanacted Pearl Harbor, then I flew a 1944 USAAF mission over Europe. Also the game has language of course, and some noseart is a little, well, you know. But this can be fixed. You can switch off subtitles, and for languages that you can understand you can simply delete the "bad word" files. And nose art files you dont approve of can be deleted also. If my instructions arent very clear, I'm sure you can look up how to do it. Anyways, the aircraft selection is wonderful, you can fly aircraft from all the major powers, (some smaller countries too). You can fly alot of stuff from 1930s biplanes, P-51s, all the way up to late WW2 jets, including some wacky German experimental aircraft. Also, a very neat feature is that you can take a picture of your face and use it to make your own pilot! You can zoom in on your plane and it's you in the cockpit! I love it. You can create your own nose art and slogans too, along with entire paint jobs. But I dont know a whole lot about that besides adding art and text to the plane. So yeah, overall I would recommend it, it works for me. "You stay classy". *clicks tongue, puts on goggles, and flies away* Merry Christmas by the way. Hopefully you'll be getting something from steam. I'm probably going to get T-72 Balkans on Fire next.

13015810.review:
After realizing my last review looked like complete sh!t, I've decided to re-do it and make it simple.

Pros:
-Great Aircraft Selection.
-Easy Controls, I used a mouse and keyboard, and still had a blast.
-Fantastic Damage Model, you can actually see bits and pieces, plus the pilot bailing out of his aircraft after you obliterate him.
-Engaging combat, the AI sure know how to get the blood flowing.
-Large map selection.
-Dynamic Campaign, which is very, very unique, you can play as someone in a certain rank, in a squadron, or work your way up, there's even a bit of RP elements, as you can change your picture, personally, I changed mine to a s3xy pin-up model, gotta give some lovin' to those hotties.
-Very well optimized, I never crashed once.

Cons: 
-Somewhat dated graphics, however that's understandable, the game is like 11 years old, and there's mods to fix that issue.
-The AI can be really stupid at times, missing ground targets almost everytime, whether with a bomb, rocket or machine guns, or how big the target is, the AI can miss it completely if there's not enough planes attacking a target. They're better at carpet-bombing and torpedoeing.
-A few missing planes from the aircraft selection, I unfortunately didn't see any P-40Ms, or any F8F Bearcats, still a very wide selection, again, most of it can be fixed with mods.

To sum it up, with how many pros I gave this game, this game doesn't lack in anything really, it does it's job, an air combat sim. I found it hard to find any negatives, but if you've got the money, definately buy the game, it's well worth the price if you're a fan of WW2, and or aircraft.
9/10.

Mother and father get little tired from building Communism, so they want to go to Moscow to buy vodka. They call most trusted babysitter. When babysitter arrives, children already sleep in beds. Babysitter just sits around and make sure everything good with children. Later that night, babysitter gets bored and goes to read Marx, but she cant read downstairs because there's no electricity (parents didnt want children reading Marx all night long). 
So, she calls parents and asks if she can get candles to read Marx in their room. Of course, the parents say it okay, but babysitter has one final request. She ask if she could cover up Lenin statue outside bedroom window with blanket or cloth, because it make her nervous. 
Phone line is silent for moment, and father who say, "Take children and get out of house. We will call militia. We do not have Lenin statue." 
Militia find all three of house occupants dead because KGB kill them for try to cover Lenin statue. Then militia arrest parents for not having Lenin statue. 
Such is life in Moscow.

12656275.review:
One of the best in (WW2) flightsims I've seen, with varying difficulty that you can customise in details and plenty of mods available to change up your experience. This is the one I'd recommend if anyone wants to get a flightsim.

Grab a joystick(Keyboard flying is possible, but can't beat a joystick), take off and go on a long campaign that can be lengthened further by mods, or just fly around in random battles. The only thing I can think of that this game doesn't do right is the AI, who seems perfectly fine with flying straight at an AA gun in formation while it is shooting them for over 30 minutes straight, and missing every last shot. Other than that, I've not found much wrong with it.
Multiplayer took me a bit to get working, but it's worth it

Good damage modeling, good flight models, and it's pretty to look at as a bonus. If you're into flightsims or want to get into flightsims, grab this one

十数年という長い歴史を持つレシプロコンバットフライトシムの決定版。私はSteam版が出る前からプレイしており、おそらく自身のプレイ時間は2016年現在7年間プレイしていて5000時間を超えていると思う。
レシプロコンバットシムの中では一番乗れる機体の数が多く（MOD等を含めると200機以上にもなる）、グラフィックやフライトモデルは最新のものに及ばないものの(逆に低スペックPCでもプレイができると言った利点にもなっている)シムとしては十分な完成度であり、IL-2で自在に飛行、離着陸が出来る頃には他のフライトシムでも問題なく操縦が出来るようになっているだろう。
非常に幅広く楽しめるゲームなのでレシプロコンバットシムの入門として強くオススメします。
フライトシムという性質上ジョイスティック等はほぼ必須なので別途用意すること。

MODを入れたりして乗れる機体を増やしたりコクピットやオブジェクトなどを綺麗にしたり、フルコミッションビルダーを使って飛行機や戦車、船等を並べて戦わせたりなどといった楽しみもあり、フライトシム単体としてだけではなく多くの楽しみ方があるといった点もこのゲームの魅力といえるだろう。
Steamでは価格も定価で980円と非常に安価であるし、セールの時は280円程度にまで値下がりすることもあるので一先ず手に入れて置いて欲しいゲームだ。

11530598.review:
This game is, and always will be, the best WWII Flight Sim of the decade. The simulator has a myriad of options, features, possibilites, and systems. The fact that I can take off, set my radiator, propellor pitch, ask the tower for weather information, and then go off an shoot the ailerons off of a HE-111 is mindblowing to me.

PROS: Very realistic flight dynamics, dynamic procedurally-generated campaigns, realistic and pretty destruction models, accurate cockpits and aircraft, 100+ aircraft, huge living maps with towns, bases, roads, supply lines, and weather.

CONS: The lighting engine is nothing special, awful polka music in menus, forests are composed of 2D lie trees, your pilot might just get shot in the face immediately after takeoff, really poor and repetitive radio voice clips, unforgiving flight dynamics: DO NOT BUY THIS IF YOU ARE NOT FAMILIAR WITH REALISTIC FLIGHT SIMULATION.

The satisfaction you can get from lighting an A6M on fire over the pacific, or land on a carrier in terrible weather is something unmatched by any of the other games in the genre - and I've played most. Only in IL-2 could you spend a sortie hunting down and destroying enemy supply lines on your own accord, get your rudder blown off, and then safely land on a dirt road in Smolensk.

All in all, I've had this game on every PC since I've discovered it, and this is really something else if you're into aviation. As with most flight sims, it is a niche product; but I can tell you that if the glove fits, you won't regret buying it.

11161881.review:
If you are into simulators, especially WWII flight simulators, this is a game for you. Ideally, you'd also want to use a joystick, as the control scheme is much more fluid and easy to use with a stick compared to the keyboard.

Once you start the game you can choose between doing the story missions or trying out pilot school, which is intended to prepare you for the more intense story missions. There are also video tutorials available to watch, which are extremely useful and strongly recommended. The videos will teach you everything from taking off, to landing, to dropping bombs on your enemies and dogfighting.

At the start, I had A LOT of trouble getting my plan to even successfully lift off the ground. Be patient, as you will probably see many "engine inoperable" notifications (if you haven't already blown up or overheated your engine by this point). The control scheme is a little spread out, but it shouldn't be too difficult to familiarize yourself with the layout. The learning curve for the game is not too steep, but it can be difficult in the beginning. Give yourself plenty of time to get used to taking off, and everything else will be easy to pick up after that.

The graphics are a little dated, but when you get into a skirmish or large-scale battle, you will love the intensity of the fighting. 

Definitely recommend for the (war) flight simulator junkies.

11078892.review:
IL-2 Sturmovik and me go way back to 2002, about a year after the original came out. Used to fly around in my BF-109 and wreak havok on the skies, destroying ME-262's as quickly as they came. I was 7 then.

Then I lost the disk and I was crushed, my favorite game was lost. It took me 8 years to find another copy at the bottom of the "unwanted" bin (let's face it, those piles of games just sitting there in those boxes? They're mostly junk with a few flecks of gold every now and then) at Wal-Mart, and I was in love all over again.

Then I found 1946. I had heard about it while surfing Ubisoft back in '10 and I was instantly hooked, and that was before I realized that it came with EVERY IL-2 ever released before 2007!

Now I terrorize the skies in my P-38L and I couldn't be happier! Plus the lads at SAS and thier modding community always come up with something to make IL-2 interesting (BF-109 and FW-190 super packs, an MI-24V Hind etc).

10/10 all day every day and twice on Sunday!

11012788.review: It may be eight years old, but IL-2 1946 still holds a candle to more recent sims on the market. It's an affordable entry into the world of flight simulators, and has something to offer the novice as well as the experienced enthusiast. While DCS and other titles that share the philosophy of its developers opt for maximum realism, IL-2 exceeds in the area of bredth without sacrificing the depth and detail necessary for a proper sim. The amount of aircraft and maps included is impressive, and combined with the active modding and tweaking scene, the possibilities for fun and engaging scenarios are huge. For the low price, you're getting a game that's polished with realism, variety, and accessibility. It is my WWII sim of choice.

9688891.review:
Simulador de Vuelo de Aviones de Combate de la Segunda Guerra. Contiene muchos comandos, por lo que el teclado se utiliza por completo, podría decirse. El realismo es casi verídico. Un juego muy complejo para los iniciados, pero que tras ganar millas, se puede volver muy entretenido. Las misiones son bastante verosímiles: los vuelos largos, sin mucho para hacer, salvo direccionar correctamente el avión hacia su rumbo debido hasta llegar a las zonas de conflicto, persecusiones largas, y aterrizajes que requieren bastante habilidad. 
Hay misiones en las que uno puede optar por ser bombardero o torpedero y atacar buques, ciudades, aeropuertos entre otras cosas, siendo estas misiones difíciles y de alto riesgo.
La dificultad realista es la más interesante de usar, a pesar de ser la más difícil, pero es la mejor manera de aprender a pilotar un avión de combate.
En este juego es recomendable el uso de joystick con movimientos "X,Y" junto con pedales, o joystick con movimientos "X,Y,Z", pero siempre con muchos botones programables, porque es probable que uno se quede sin comandos en el teclado.
Los gráficos son muy buenos, la jugabilidad es muy buena, el entretenimiento que uno pueda llegar a tener tiende a ser alto aunque su adicción no creo que sea alta.
Recomiendo altamente este juego para el apasionado de los simuladores de vuelo.

9579795.review:
GET A JOYSTICK. 

This is by far the best WWII sim game I've ever played! The graphics are pretty dated but the gameplay and physics definetly still hold up. The game is unplayable without a joystick though, so It'd be a good idea to get one. If you can get your hands on a joystick that will handle Pitch, roll, Yaw, and throttle, that's optimal. If you can only get a stick that does Pitch, roll, and throttle, like the logitech Attack 3, you can do what i do and plug in another usb controller (ps4 controller, wired 360 controller, anything with a stick) and map the rudder to one of the sticks on that. It's not the best solution but having rudder control adds so much to the game.

I recommend this game to any WWII enthusiast, or even anyone who's ever wanted to learn to fly. The game implements many real flying issues like Stalls, Spins, torque, and engine heat!  Of course, if you want a more arcade-like experience, you can turn these features off and have a "point-and-go" flight experience as  well.
