9470332.review:
This is the worst stealth game I have ever played.
Upon starting up the game, you are told that your name is "John 'mad' Doe." You are a freelance stealth operative who works around for the different countries during WW2.  It is then up to you to choose a country to work for and do what you do best, that is sabatoge of enemy bases. After choosing your country, you will be brought to a menu where you are given a briefing on your mission.  Here, you can customize John's loadout, equipment and even choose apropriate camoflauge for the mission.  You are then thrown into a giant open world map, with multiple routes to complete your objective. you are also sometimes given a set of more than capable AI teamates.  This is all very nice and well implemented, it's just to bad that they didn't focus more on the "game" part of this "game"
The amount of controls for this game are absolutely ludicrous.  You will probably end up having to rebind and memorize over 100 different keystrokes just to make the game playable.  After that, you will of course try and move to your objective. However, the developers of this game didn't understand the concept of a "stealth" game.  Any time you try and move john around, you might as well be playing the sound of a b-52 bomber over a boombox at full volume.  It is not remotely possible to sneak around in this game.  On top of this, if you try to turn John around to fast or make to sudden a move, he will fall over to the ground faster than a boombox playing the sounds of a b-52 at full volume being hurled out the back of a b-52.
You might be thinking now "Well if I can't get close to the enemy, I'll just take them out from far away."  That's just the problem.  Every weapon in the game has no silencer. You might as well be firing rockets, dropping bombs or shooting a .50 cal machine gun at them.  Finally, there is also no way to see how visible you are to enemies.  Since the maps or so open, you can literally be seen by an enemy miles away.
Overall this is a poor excuse for a stealth game.  Stay away from it, and instead look at better stealth games like the original thief.

You might be thinking now "Well if I can't get close to the enemy, I'll just take them out from far away."  That's just the problem.  Every weapon in the game has no silencer. You might as well be firing rockets, dropping bombs or shooting a .50 cal machine gun at them.  Finally, there is also no way to see how visible you are to enemies.  Since the maps or so open, you can literally be seen by an enemy miles away.
Overall this is a poor excuse for a stealth game.  Stay away from it, and instead look at better stealth games like the original thief.

В 2001 году на свет появилась российская игра ИЛ-2 Штурмовик, в которой игрокам предстояло взять на себя управление боевыми самолетами того времени и отправиться на выполнение опасных миссий. Я понимаю что спустя 16 лет графика смотрится очень блекло, но не смотря на это, игра до сих пор остается одной из лучших в плане управления самолетом. Оно и неудивительно, ведь в ИЛ-2 Штурмовик представлено более 70 моделей, созданных по официальным чертежам. Игра содержит огромное количество миссий, где игрок будет выполнять самые различные задачи, используя различные модели боевых самолетов, к каждому из которых нужен свой подход. Иногда придется уничтожать наземную технику врага, а иногда защищаться от вражеских истребителей, поражая исключительно воздушные цели. Если вы фанат авиасимуляторов, то ИЛ-2 Штурмовик как нельзя лучше подойдет для того, чтобы встретиться с немецкими войсками в воздухе.

Я знаю эту игру ещё с далекого 2004 и, признаюсь, нисколько не разочарован в ней. В дополнениях вшиты небольшие изменения, касающиеся графики как окружающей среды, так и самих моделей самолетов. Лучший симулятор полетов, даже по сегодняшним расценкам. Уверен, что у неё много фанов, которые и без меня знают это, но всё же:
+ более 114 моделей самолетов
+ хорошо проработанная физика
+ повреждения Вашей "пташки" выглядят реалистично и влияют на управление
+ ночные задания (вызывают у меня приступы умиления)
- полёты более 50км становятся скучны
- недопиленный мултиплэер
Так что советую обзавестись джойстиком и приятно провести время за штурвалом знаменитого Ил-2 или не менее знаменитого Bf-109!

8660027.review:
Since I'm a bit of a plane junkie, this game appealed to me greatly, so my review may be a bit biased.

If you're the type who wants something similar to Ace Combat, look elsewhere. You won't be zooming about in the air doing on a dime turns in some super OP plane, just blasting people out of the sky left and right. This game requires a great deal of patience and skill to really play well, especially online against other people. The modeling of planes and all their related systems is really good, as it should be for a WW2 flight simulator. You can fly most major aircraft from all major sides in the war, ranging from the eponymous IL-2 ground attack plane, to a Japanese Zero or a P-51. 

That all being said, a joystick (preferrably HOTAS) is damn near a requirement to get the most out of this game. Without it you'll be stretching your fingers and your brain to remember all the controls on a keyboard. You can set the realism to lower levels so you won't have to worry about having to open radiator cowls, ammo counts, fuel status and the like, but IMO that takes away from the fun of the game.

If you're a flight simulator junkie like me, and am willing to drop a few bucks on a good joystick setup, this game is definitely worth the price.

NOTE: If you don't have a flight stick, don't purchase. 

If you've got a joystick/flight stick and you've got a tolerance for a high learning curve (There is adjustable difficulty based on realism and UI) then I'd would highly recommend this game. 
The thing that separates this from other simulator games is that the hardest part isn't the end of the journey. Examples of that include landing in just about any other flight sim or parking in Euro Truck Sim. 
The hardest part of this game is surviving the middle of the journey, especially if you're in a F4U Corsair fighting multiple, highly manueverable "Zeros". 
I'm not that great at this game, but I've seen people fly like ballerinas in some videos using the entire realism content that the game does provide. It's the thought that you can gain some degree of skill in this game that keeps me coming back for more and more.
Even though it is rather dated looking it is quickly becoming one of my favorite purchases of 2013. If there was something for me in it, there may also be something for you.

8133369.review:
Il2 is a realistic flight sim game featuring aircraft from pre world war 2 era to the late 40s. The aircraft are modeled very realistically featuring an advanced damage model where individual parts of your aircraft can take damage and affect the performance of the plane. 
Most of the aircraft in the game are very realistically modeled using performance data from actual aircraft. (except the Nazi secret aircraft added in the 1946 edition).
You can play story campaigns, dynamic campaigns and single missions.The game includes a very advanced campaign editor that lets you create your own campaign and missions.

To truly have fun in this game you need to play multiplayer or get into the modding scene. However matchmaking is not possible from within the game and you need to get Hyperlobby (which is free). Once you have that installed you can easily join multiplayer matches.

A huge (and still active) modding community keeps adding new content and really adds to the games replay-ability. From extra missions to entire story campaigns, hundreds of downloadable aircraft and  semi official patches that steam will not install and you have to get it manually. 

Il2 is a must play game for any flight sim fan or any aircraft enthusiast. With a friendly  community that promises to remain active for years,

8110742.review: Old but realistic. Good ole flight simulator fun. This is the original IL-2 Sturmovik game for enthusiasts.

8066356.review:
As a player of IL2 for some years now, I must say it was definitely "Love at First Flight".

This Classic Flight Combat Sim was the game of My dreams when I fortunately stumbled onto it while browsing Steams Virtual shelves. Being a History enthusiast kinda Kat an fascinated by what it must of been like for the Brave Airmen of All Nations. Being thousands of FT/Meters up in the Blue Yonder is still kind of nerve racking on a Modern Commercial flight. Let alone with 1940's Tech and Enemy combatants trying to ruin your experience a la The Sun to Icarus. 

Considering the age of this Fine title it's still Very Much a Beautiful ode  to those who actually went through this interesting era in History.
Detailed damage modeling from portions of your Aircraft getting blown away, sometimes affecting your Plane's controls an functions. Fuel leaks & Fires, Instrument Panels destroyed in the Cockpit.  Pilots can be Wounded in various locals of Body causing control to get progressively worse as you bleed out or Insta-Death. 

All Depending on where the plane was hit.

Turbulence, Wind, Stalls, RedOut and BlackOut from pulling hard G's is also modeled. 
All wrapped in a lovingly crafted Flight Engine, that still stands well against Time. Allowing you to take to the AirWar with a Ridiculously extensive list of flyable Machines each with their own Characteristic Charms. 
It culminates into a package that breathes Visceral Life into those Noble Duels between Men at a time foregone; The perfect melding of Man and Machine...Air Combat of WWII.
 If that's what you're looking for then, IL2 1946 completes the mission....Like a Ace.
 
Official patches dropping seldom to maintain the game and still adding Planes. Not to mention the likewise Legendary Modding Community. That is Still active in bringing Great content such as Skins, Cockpits, Planes, Gfx packs, Sound Packs, Maps, Missions & Campaigns. New Theaters to Fly even, WWI(DBW1916)& JetWar '56! Thee latter adding new munitions, Missiles & Nukes! and Even Radar on the most recent MiGs!! 

Infinite Thanks to all Devs and Modders for this labor of love.

Sincerely,
- An appreciative Fan

1011617.review:
You'll definitely need at least an analog gamepad to play this game, and every pilot will recommend that you invest in an inexpensive joystick like the Logitech X3D.

Don't jump straight into the campaign - this is a fairly realistic flight sim. Best way to start this game is to fly single missions in an easy to fly plane (I recommend the La-5FN) until you're comfortable with:

1. Taking off and landing
2. Performing aerobatics
3. One-on-one air combat (Basic Fighter Maneuvers). To learn this, I highly recommend the Falcon 3 BFM tutorial - look up "Art of the Kill Falcon 3" on Youtube. 

Ultimately, though, remember that you're basically learning to fly combat aircraft, so be prepared to give the game some time. It'll take a while to get comfortable, and you'll be pulling G's with sim (and real life!) pilots with 1000s of hours of flight time under their belts, but as stated in other reviews, it's a very enjoyable game once you finally straighen up and fly right.

4910232.review: Many years ago I discovered this game, Its only now I've bought the complete collection. One of the few simulators that maintains both the realism and immersion of flight as well as the intensity of air based combat. This game can be somewhat beginner unfriendly at times. With no in game tutorial your left on your own to learn the basics of flight, dogfighting and bombing. IL2 is a simulator, so you will spend much time flying to your objectives, and monitoring your flight indicators and fine tuning control surfaces. With hundreds of accurately detailed and performing aircraft, as well as a wide selection of war theatre and maps IL-2 sturmovik is a must have for any flight sim or dogfight enthusiast. I find this game to be a perfect blend of fun and realisim. I'm not going to say it easy, however even with its age IL2 1946 remains an unsung milestone in the flight genre of videogames.

What can I say, probably THE best and most versatile combat flight simulator by a longshot. It will satisfy any dogfight enthusiast, from the arcade player to the most hardcore realism junkie. 

The physics are very well recreated (but one can choose not to activate them for a more casual experience), and players have the options to choose how to equip there plane and wether they want limited ammo/fuel or not.
Plane models are near perfect reconstitutions of real WW2 crafts, either built or imagined. The "1946" jets and heliplanes are a sight to see.

Finally, experience missions like a real ww2 pilot : learn the map and fly on sight, as there is no minimap.

I truly recommend this to anyone (it's way better than BF jets, more visceral)

60994.review: The best $10 you can possibly spend on Steam. This game is incredible. You won't find many other games that can match the challenge that IL-2 presents. The tactical depth is infinite and the difficulty is high but the satisfaction of improving your skills is immense. This is a hardcore flight simulator, so don't expect a shallow learning curve. Speed, accuracy and finesse with the controls are a must. Situational awareness is equally critical, as are reflexes, decisionmaking and tactical analysis, teamwork and communication, etc. The demands are high, but the reward is great. Of course you also have to fly your plane; proper engine management is very important, as is a basic understanding of aerodynamics and flight physics.. However, while the game DOES expect alot from you, it does also strike a near-perfect balance by introducing the challenge of a flight simulator while avoiding overly-complicated modern avionics and difficult-to-learn computer systems. cont'd..

Graphically detailed (for its age), historically accurate and relentlessly difficult in full-on simulation mode, IL-2 is an amazing flight simulator. Though it can be dumbed down a bit, this is no arcade flight sim. Instead it's a physically realistic air combat SIMULATOR. 

Everything from managing the richness of your fuel mixture, adjusting the pitch of your propellor,  to having to trim your plane to compensate for engine torque makes IL-2 the flight sim I've been looking for.

I highly recommend this game. If the "Cliffs of Dover" coming out soon is just as good it'll be a must have for throttle-jockys as well.
